abstract: Given his repeated entreaties to the Bancroft family and his recent promises to shield The Wall Street Journal’s newsroom from his own meddling as owner, News Corporation chief Rupert Murdoch seems almost desperate to buy Dow Jones. He has written three letters to pitch his proposal and offered to hold tetes-a-tetes with the family members, who have a controlling stake in the company — all this on top of the rich premium contained in his $5 billion offer. But there is something else the media mogul can do, according to Breakingviews: Throw more bags of money at the Bancrofts, while leaving common shareholders with his current offer.
